radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is distended with gallbladder wall edema and thickening of the wall measuring up to 3 mm. There are extensive intraluminal stones with a stone noted impacted within the gallbladder neck. There is a positive sonographic Murphy sign. There is a small amount of increased vascularity within the gallbladder wall. The liver demonstrates no focal or textural abnormalities and the main portal vein is patent with appropriate hepatopetal flow. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation with the common bile duct measuring up to 6 mm.
